text: <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a member of the forkhead / winged-helix family of transcriptional regulators , and its expression in T reg cells is essential for their development and function ( Fontenot et al . , 2003 ; Williams and Rudensky , 2007 ) .

A spontaneous mutation of the X - linked <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene inscurfymice causes an autoimmune-like disease , whereas the mutation in humans leads to immunodysregulation , polyendocrinopathy , enteropathy , and X - linked syndrome that is also a severe multiorgan autoimmune disease with hyper-IgE ( Ziegler , 2006 ) .

Although the essential role of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in central and peripheral tolerance has been extensively studied , its regulation , cooperation with other transcription factors , and how it functions in inducible T reg ( iT reg ) cells to suppress various target genes is mostly not yet understood .

It is known that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cooperates with the nuclear factor of activated T cells ( NFAT ) or nuclear factor-kappa B ( NF-kappaB ) to regulate the transcription of different target genes ( Schubert et al . , 2001 ; Bettelli et al . , 2005 ; Wu et al . , 2006 ) .
The Th2 cytokine <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression during T cell priming .

text: Although natural T reg ( nT reg ) cells that differentiate in the thymus are characterized by their stable <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression , the generation of iT reg cells specific for allergens , alloantigens , and autoantigens in the periphery has been associated with a transient <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + phenotype ( Fontenot et al . , 2003 ; Hori et al . , 2003 ) .

The crucial role of <extra_id_0> TGF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in their generation has been demonstrated.The <extra_id_0> RUNX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene family ( Runt-related transcription factor , acute myeloid leukemia [ AML ] , core - binding factor-alpha [ CBFalpha ] , and polyoma enhancer - binding protein-2alpha [ PEBP2alpha ] ) contains three members , <extra_id_0> RUNX1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> AML1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CBFA2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> PEBP2alphaB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , <extra_id_0> RUNX2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> AML3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CBFA1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> PEBP2alphaA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , and <extra_id_0> RUNX3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( AML2 / CBFA3 / PEBP2alphaC ) .
They are essential transcriptional regulators of different developmental pathways .
<extra_id_0> RUNX2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is mostly important for bone development and osteoblast differentiation ( Komori et al . , 1997 ) .

<extra_id_0> RUNX1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays an important role in hematopoiesis during development , and <extra_id_0> RUNX3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has important functions in thymogenesis and neurogenesis ( Wang et al . , 1996 ; Inoue et al . , 2002 ; Levanon et al . , 2002 ) .

<extra_id_0> RUNX1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RUNX3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also work together in the establishment of lineage specification of T lymphocytes ( Taniuchi et al . , 2002 ; Egawa et al . , 2007 ) .

<extra_id_0> RUNX1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a frequent target for chromosomal translocations associated with leukemias ( Look , 1997 ) , and <extra_id_0> RUNX3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> methylation and silencing is observed in various human epithelial cancers ( Blyth et al . , 2005 ) .
<extra_id_0> RUNX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> family members share the Runt domain , which is responsible for DNA binding ( Ito , 1999 ) .
The Runt domain - containing protein constitutes the alpha-chain partner of the heterodimeric <extra_id_0> CBF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> complex .

RUNX proteins heterodimerize with the non-DNA - binding partner , <extra_id_0> CBFbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which increases the affinity for DNA binding and stabilizes the complex by preventing <extra_id_0> ubiquitin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent degradation ( Wang et al . , 1993 ) .
The <extra_id_0> CBF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> complexes regulate the expression of cellular genes through binding to promoters or enhancer elements .
The effects of the <extra_id_0> RUNX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> CBFbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> complex regulation are clearly cell lineage and stage specific .
They include the crucial choices between cell-cycle exit and continued proliferation , as well as between cell differentiation and self-renewal ( Blyth et al . , 2005 ) .

Because of the involvement of <extra_id_0> RUNX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutations in different autoimmune diseases and the known interaction with <extra_id_0> TGF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we investigated the impact of <extra_id_0> RUNX1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RUNX3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the expression of <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and subsequently on the development and function of iT reg cells .
